alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Screven (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 30 at 7:24PM EDT until July 30 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF SCREVEN AND BULLOCH COUNTIES... At 723 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Woodcliff to near Statesboro, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. At 720 pm, trees were reported down between Portal and Rocky Ford. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of Screven and Bulloch Counties, including the following locations... Westchester, Statesboro Mall, Middleground, Cooperville, Hunters Pointe, Farmdale, Huntington, Cameron, Mill Creek Park, and Goloid. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
